references.paper_title: Gemini: A family of highly capable multimodal models
references.reason: This paper introduces Gemini, a family of multimodal models that are highly capable and relevant to the advancement of LLM agents.

references.paper_title: Sparks of artificial general intelligence: Early experiments with GPT-4
references.reason: This paper presents early experiments with GPT-4, highlighting its capabilities and potential as a foundation for advanced LLM agents.

references.paper_title: Toolformer: Language models can teach themselves to use tools
references.reason: This paper introduces Toolformer, a model that demonstrates the ability of LLMs to learn to use tools, a crucial aspect of LLM agent development.

references.paper_title: React: Synergizing reasoning and acting in language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the ReAct framework, a widely used approach in LLM agent design that interleaves reasoning and action steps.

references.paper_title: GAIA: a benchmark for general AI assistants
references.reason: This paper introduces the GAIA benchmark, a comprehensive suite designed to evaluate the generality and adaptability of intelligent agents, on which the proposed framework is evaluated.
